title: José Pinzón
text:
José Pinzón (born August 22, 1987) is a <a href="Mexican%20people">Mexican</a> professional <a href="Boxing">boxer</a> who was the <a href="World%20Boxing%20Council">WBC</a> Youth <a href="light%20middleweight">light middleweight</a> Champion. Pinzón is trained by former <a href="World%20Boxing%20Council">WBC</a> Champion <a href="Guty%20Espadas">Guty Espadas, Sr.</a>
Professional career.
On October 2, 2010 Pinzón got revenge and a knockout over the only boxer to beat him Jaime Barboza, to win the <a href="World%20Boxing%20Council">WBC Youth World</a> <a href="Light%20Middleweight">Light Middleweight</a> Championship.
In his next José lost to <a href="Poland">Poland</a>'s <a href="Pawel%20Wolak">Pawel Wolak</a> on the undercard of the Donaire-Sidorenko fight, José took the fight on one week notice.
